chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn L. Donovan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up.  
DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Clerk Amy. 
Case called:  9:04 a.m. 
INCLUDES 20CF564, 20CF644, 21CF1336, 21CF1562, 22CF186.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in person from MCJ with Attorney Jay Kronenwetter.  

Date and time set for plea/sentencing hearing on all matters except 21CF1562; VRCW.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

20CF564>>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Battery); COURT grants. 
Count 3 (Disorderly Conduct); COURT grants. 

21CF1336>>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 1 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants. 
Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony); COURT grants.
Count 5 (Posses Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce or Store Methamphetamine/PTAC); COURT grants. 
Count 6 (Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude); COURT grants. 
Count 7 (Operating While Revoked); COURT grants. 
Count 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC); COURT grants.  

22CF186>>State moves to DRI: 
Count 4 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 5 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT grants.
Count 6 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater); COURT grants.

PLEA: 

20CF644>>Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine): GUILTY.  

22CF186>>Count 1 (Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent): NO CONTEST.  
22CF186>>Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater):  GUILTY.  
22CF186>>Count 3 (Bail Jumping-Felony/Repeater):  GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS on each count:  3 years WI State Prison (1 year IC/2 years ES); concurrent with each other.  

CONDITIONS of ES:  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week combined, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  No possession of drug paraphernalia. AODA and follow up.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/SAP. 

COURT grants 174 days credit in 22CF186 and 375 days credit in 20CF644.

ADA Coonen advises they are requesting restitution in the amount of $4920.00 including 10% surcharge on 22CF186; Atty Kronenwetter objects and requests hearing bet set.  

COURT orders restitution be set within statutory time frame after today's proceedings; COURT will allow deft to appear by video if State is not calling any witnesses.  

COURT directs parties to set trial dates on 21CF1562.

Adj:  9:31 a.m.
Restitution hearing on September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADA Coonen makes statement re: trial in 20CF644; cannot get detective here for trial so filed request for adjournment. ADA Coonen advises drug results were received but still requests to have a different case to be tried instead of 20CF644.
Atty Kronenwetter has no objection to adjournment of 20CF644 and set 22CF186 for trial in its place; State agrees.  COURT grants. 

COURT grants switch of speedy trial demand from 20CF644 to 22CF186. 

COURT will have JT switched to 22CF186 on 8/2/2022.

COURT directs parties to set call on 7/27/22 at 8:05 a.m. to check status of negotiations and if trial is going foward.

Judicial Pretrial - in court on February 14, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

No contact with victim(s): A.J.S. or R.A.M. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
